summary.p:
A multi-text (possibly composite?) manuscript, entitled Cāsttiram Aintu on its additional title page, containing the following works on traditional medicine:
The Ñāṉaveṭṭiyāṉ kaṟpamuṟai aṟuva? viruttam (enlisted on the title page as: "Kaṟpamuṟai", "Recipes for panacea"), a medical text ascribed to author named "Veṭṭiyāṉ", in 61 verses (f1r-7r) (U2).
The Karuvūrār palatiraṭṭu muṉṉūṟu ("Karuvūrār palatiraṭṭu", "Anthology of Karuvūrār"), a medical text ascribed to siddhar Karuvūrār, in 229 verses (marginal title suggests, that the original text consisted of approx. 300 verses, so the text in the manuscript seems to be incomplete), f8r-38r (U3).
The Akasttiyar tirunaṭaṉa cūsttiram ("Tirunaṭaṉa cūttiram", "Treatise on the Sacred Dance"), a text on medicine and yoga ascribed to siddhar Akasttiyar, in 48 verses (f1r- 7v [f39r -45v]) (U4).
The Pañcarattiṉa pūpati māttirai ("Pañcarattiṉa pūpati mālai", "Royal garland of the five jewels" ), a medical text containing several pratical recpies (f1-5v [f46r-50v]) (U5).
Vayittiya cillaṟai ("Fragments on medicine"), a text which consists of several medical recipes (f1r-4r [51r-54r]) (U6).

collation.desc: 7 folios = Nāṉa veṭṭiyāṉ kaṟpamuṟai aṟuva? viruttam. Tamil foliation 1-7. Arabic foliation 1-7.
31 folios = Karuvūrār palatiraṭṭu muṉṉūṟu. Tamil foliation 8-38. Arabic foliation 8-38.
7 folios = Akastiyar tirunaṭaṉa cūstiram. Tamil foliation 1-7. Arabic foliation 39-45.
5 folios = Pañcarattiṉa pūpati māttirai. Tamil foliation 1-5. Arabic foliation 46-50.
5 folios = Vayittiya cillaṟai. Tamil foliation 1-5. Arabic foliation 51-55. f5 seems to be orginally a guard-leaf.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil letter-numerals on left margin, Arabic numerals in pencil on right margin.
supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation, in spite of bore holes caused by insects.

decoNote.desc: Seven "floral" shapes composed of six circles each (U6, folio 5v). See also U1 (f[1]v).

Left-marginal intertitles for recipes: kāḷakattiṉ muṟai (f13v); racapaṣpam (f15r).

Left-marginal intertitles: Aritāra [kaṭ]ṭu kentakak kaṭṭu (f1/39v); pāṣāṇak kaṭṭu nākak kaṭṭu (f2/40r); ..? rōkam cempu cutti (f2/40v); turuci[u] kuru (f3/41r); lēkiyam naṭaṉa tericaṉa yōkattukku Aṭcaram veṭṭai (f3/41v); Uppu centūram vayirava cakkara viti (f4/42r); kurumuṭippu (f4/42v); pañcalēkiyam tilakam (f5/43r); Aṣṭalēkiyam citampara tīṭcai (f5/43v); vāṭai (f6/44r); kaṭuppu vikkal ayaccempu centūram(f7/45r); veḷḷīya paṟpam (f7/45v).

Left-marginal intertitles (names of preparations): Akkiṉi kumāraṉ arttaṉārīsvarar(f1/46v, lm); tāmpara kaṭkam liṅkakkuḻampu (f2/47r, lm); liṅka centūram (f2/47r, framed, in central position); pētiyāki iṟatturu[m] maruntu Uṣṇapētik=ki maruntu (f2/47v, 1c, lm); tīvaṉamuṇṭākiṟatu (f2/47v, 2c, lm); vayiṟṟerivukkumaruntu tātu puṣṭikki Eḻumicca lēkiyam(f2/47v, 3c, lm); matusmi racāyaṉam (f3/48r, lm); mukakkūṭṭu tayilam (f3/48v, 2c, lm); pañcalavaṇa navalōka meḻuku (f4/49r, lm); cārattirāvakam (f5/50r, lm); caṇṭaracapaspam (f5/50v, lm).

Left-marginal intertitles (names of recipes): cayittiyattuk[k]u caḷippukku curattukku kuḷikai (f1/51r, lm); riṇaṅkaḷāṟa piḷāttiri [piḷāstiri] (f1/51v, lm); pētiyākātu miḷaku kuḻampu (f2/52r, 1c, lm); ratta cīta pēti yāṉu? kaṭṭu kuṟa ?[l]ēkiyam (f2/52r, 2c, lm); cūṭūkaḷ taṇiya lēkiyam rāvil cāppiṭṭu paṭukkap pōkac ce cāppiṭu kuṟatu pat=tiyam il[l]ai (f2/52v, lm) (marginal heading with preparation name and instructions for taking the drug); Acirṇa mantattukku kiyāḻam (f3/53r, 1c, lm); curatōṣa kiyāḻam pāṭal (f3/53r, 2c, lm); māttirai paṇṇutaṟ vipāram (f3/53r, 2c (frame), lm); kaṇṇerivu kālerivu talaiyerivu ?yatterivu kiṟukiṟuppu yitukaḷuku talaimuḻuku tayilam oru talaivaliyun tīrum (f3/53v, lm); uḷaṭṭiṉattukku lēkiyam (f4/54r, 1c, lm); ceraṅkukaḷuk[k]u tayilam (f4/54r, 2c, lm); puṇṇukku kāramāta tirai (f4/54v, 2c, lm); veṭṭaikku maruntu [text unblackened] (f5/55r, lm).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated neither by Vinson (1868) nor by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 25, n0. 134..

Vinson, Julien (1868). Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 36, no. 134. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49).
